intro: Shuteria lancangensis, commonly known as the Lancang River shuteria, is a flowering plant native to the Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its botanical features include a slender stem, finely divided leaves, and white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Shuteria lancangensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
